OFFERING
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
August 9, 1955
OFFERING
Series 56-1 (Winter 1956)
Title: SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL
Type: Drama
Time: 57-90 minutes
No.: 12 programs
Origin: BBC
Audience: Adult
Release: Issue 7fl (Jan. 1)
SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL consists of six of Shake spe are *s plays, each divided into
two programs. Most have been released to NAEB Radio Network stations before, but
they have been quite popular and are therefore being released together as a series.
If you use the series THE ELIZABETHAN THEATRE, you may wish to "follow up" with
these programs. Times given are approximate.
The tape recordings should be returned to, or traded with, the NAEB Radio Net¬
work (NOT BBC).

1 (Jan. 1) A Midsummer Night*s Dream, Pt. I - Ralph Richardson as Bottom
in the comedy by William Shakespeare, with Mendelssohn*s
music arranged by John Hollingsworth who conducts the Royal
Philharmonic Orchestra and a section of the Ipswich Coopera¬
tive Girls* Choir. The production script is prepared by
Lance Sieveking, and the play is produced by Val Gielgud.
Date of expiry: Mar. 30 *56. Time: 63:51.
2 (Jan. 8) A Midsummer Night*s Dream, Pt. II. Time: 88:U2.
3 (Jan. 15) Anthony and Cleopatra, Pt. I - Michael Redgrave as Anthony and
Peggy Ashcroft as Cleopatra in the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre
Conpany*s presentation of "Anthony and Cleopatra." The play
is produced for radio by Peter Watts from the Stratford-on-
Avon production by Glen Byam Shaw. The music, which was com¬
posed for the stage production by Anthony Hopkins, is played
by the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre Orchestra, directed by
Harold Ingram. Date of expiry: Dec. 22 *56. Time: 59:28.

in "King Henry IV - Part One." The music is composed by
Norman Demuth, and the production is by Wilfred Grantham.
Date of expiry: Jan. 30, *57. Time: 7U:U6.
6 (Feb. 5) King Henry IV - Part One, Pt, II. Time: 7U:32.
7. 7 (Feb. 12) The Taming of the Shrew, Pt. I - Adapted for broadcasting and
produced by Peter Watts. The music is collected and arranged
by Jeremy Noble, The break between the two parts of the play
occurs in Act II, Scene I after Petruccio has fixed the day
of his marriage to Katharine and has left for Venice to buy
the apparel for the wedding. Date of expiry: Aug. 8, *57.
